CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Density functional theory ( DFT ) calculations was carried out to probe the molecular and electronic properties of the PffBB-n polymer by means of B3LYP / 6-311+(d,p) as a basis set in a vacuum using the repeating conjugated units of the polymer backbone in which all of the alkyl substitutions were replaced by ethyl groups to reduce the calculation time.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the entities in the paragraph that can be identified as "Material Name" entities:

1. PffBB-n polymer
2. B3LYP
3. 6-311+(d,p)

Explanation:

1. PffBB-n polymer: This is the name of a specific polymer material that is being studied in the paragraph.
2. B3LYP: This is the name of a basis set used in density functional theory (DFT) calculations.
3. 6-311+(d,p): This is the name of a specific basis set used in DFT calculations. The "(d,p)" indicates that it is a combination of the 6-311G basis set with the d and p functions.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here's the updated list of entities that clearly refer to Material Name:

1. PffBB-n polymer

The other entities mentioned in the paragraph, "B3LYP" and "6-311+(d,p)", are basis sets used in DFT calculations and do not refer to material names.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the valid entity presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PffBB-n polymer |

Note that the other entities mentioned in the paragraph, "B3LYP" and "6-311+(d,p)", are not included in the table as they do not refer to material names.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Density functional theory ( DFT ) calculations was carried out to probe the molecular and electronic properties of the PffBB-n polymer by means of B3LYP / 6-311+(d,p) as a basis set in a vacuum using the repeating conjugated units of the polymer backbone in which all of the alkyl substitutions were replaced by ethyl groups to reduce the calculation time.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! To identify the "Property Value" entities in the given paragraph, we can follow these steps:

1. Identify the entities that have a direct relationship with the property being discussed. In this case, the property being discussed is the "molecular and electronic properties" of the PffBB-n polymer.
2. Look for the entities that are modified or changed in order to study the property. In this case, the repeating conjugated units of the polymer backbone are modified by replacing all alkyl substitutions with ethyl groups.
3. Identify the entities that are used to calculate or study the property. In this case, the calculation is performed using B3LYP / 6-311+(d,p) as a basis set in a vacuum.

Based on the above steps, the "Property Value" entities in the given paragraph are:

1. PffBB-n polymer (the molecular and electronic properties of which are being studied)
2. B3LYP / 6-311+(d,p) (the basis set used to calculate the molecular and electronic properties)
3. Ethyl groups (which replace the alkyl substitutions in the polymer backbone to reduce calculation time)

Therefore, the "Property Value" entities in the given paragraph are the PffBB-n polymer, B3LYP / 6-311+(d,p), and ethyl groups.
